channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: First Black country club gets more than love in its coffers
item.description: Nation's first Black country club gets some love
item.content:encoded:
Nation's first Black country club gets some love

(Image credit: Courtesy of the African American Cultural Heritage Action Fund)
item.dc:creator: Buffy Gorrilla

item.title: Tropical Storm Helene is forecast to become a major hurricane as it nears Florida
item.description: Helene is forecast to intensify rapidly over the Gulf of Mexico before making landfall in Florida on Thursday. Residents are urged to make preparations — and in many counties, evacuate — before then.
item.content:encoded: Helene is forecast to intensify rapidly over the Gulf of Mexico before making landfall in Florida on Thursday. Residents are urged to make preparations — and in many counties, evacuate — before then.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Missouri executes man prosecutors thought innocent. And, FAFSA’s disastrous launch
item.description: Missouri executed Marcellus Williams yesterday, a man prosecutors believed was innocent. And, why FAFSA’s launch was so disastrous.
item.content:encoded:
Missouri executed Marcellus Williams yesterday, a man prosecutors believed was innocent. And, why FAFSA’s launch was so disastrous.

(Image credit: LA Johnson)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: 'Echoes of Wisdom' review: Zelda leads a worthwhile remix, not a revolution
item.description: Nintendo's latest game is the first to truly star Zelda in the series that has borne her name since 1986. It boasts innovative mechanics but is still a little too linked to the past.
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo's latest game is the first to truly star Zelda in the series that has borne her name since 1986. It boasts innovative mechanics but is still a little too linked to the past.

(Image credit: Nintendo)
item.dc:creator: James Perkins Mastromarino

item.title: Harris heads to Pittsburgh (again) to make a manufacturing pitch to voters
item.description: Vice President Harris is trying to win over undecided voters in key swing states like Pennsylvania. Former President Donald Trump also talked about manufacturing policy on Tuesday in Georgia.
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris is trying to win over undecided voters in key swing states like Pennsylvania. Former President Donald Trump also talked about manufacturing policy on Tuesday in Georgia.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: Europe's intense rainfall in September twice as likely thanks to climate change
item.description: Extensive early warnings and years of adaptation made the floods less deadly than they otherwise might have been.
item.content:encoded:
Extensive early warnings and years of adaptation made the floods less deadly than they otherwise might have been.

(Image credit: Maciej Krysinski/KG PSP)
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Borunda

item.title: How a catchy tune became the soundtrack to TikTok's silliest videos
item.description: The song "Monkeys Spinning Monkeys" was released ten years ago and has since become the soundtrack to millions of viral videos. Its story shows how music has shaped — and been shaped by— social media platforms.
item.content:encoded:
The song "Monkeys Spinning Monkeys" was released ten years ago and has since become the soundtrack to millions of viral videos. Its story shows how music has shaped — and been shaped by— social media platforms.

(Image credit: Kevin MacLeod)
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: Why Nevada's housing crisis is about more than Californians driving up home prices
item.description: As part of NPR’s "We, The Voters" series — we went to Nevada to talk to residents about their housing situation, the state’s affordable housing crisis and what factors are driving it.
item.content:encoded:
As part of NPR’s "We, The Voters" series — we went to Nevada to talk to residents about their housing situation, the state’s affordable housing crisis and what factors are driving it.

(Image credit: Krystal Ramirez for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Claire Murashima

item.title: Hezbollah fires missile at Tel Aviv after heavy Israeli strikes on Lebanon
item.description: Hezbollah launched a ballistic missile at Tel Aviv early Wednesday, after Israel carried out strikes on Lebanon that killed hundreds of people and the militants fired rockets across northern Israel.
item.content:encoded:
Hezbollah launched a ballistic missile at Tel Aviv early Wednesday, after Israel carried out strikes on Lebanon that killed hundreds of people and the militants fired rockets across northern Israel.

(Image credit: Ohad Zwigenberg)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Haitian group seeks charges against Trump and Vance over false Springfield claims
item.description: Charges brought by private citizens are rare, but not unheard of, in Ohio. State law requires a hearing to take place before the affidavit can move forward.
item.content:encoded:
Charges brought by private citizens are rare, but not unheard of, in Ohio. State law requires a hearing to take place before the affidavit can move forward.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
